description: There are five main road closures on Sunday for the annual 13.1-mile race.
title: Brighton: Planned road closures for Brighton Half Marathon
title_page: Brighton: Planned road closures for Brighton Half Marathon - BBC News
maintext:
There will be five main road closures for the 35th Brighton Half Marathon on Sunday.
More than 10,000 runners are expected to take on the 13.1-mile seafront course, which will start and finish at Hove Lawns on Kingsway as Madeira Terrace is awaiting a major restoration.
The closures of Kingsway-Wharf Road to Grand Avenue, Grand Avenue to West Street and Madeira Drive - West Street to Lower Rock Gardens - and St James Street will all conclude at 14:00 GMT.
St James Street to Union Road and Lower Rock Gardens to Roedean Way will be subject to shorter closures.
